Toll.definition: a charge for the use of a transportation route or facility ;broadly
Toll.origin: [Old English, tax or fee paid for a liberty or privilege, ultimately from Late Latin telonium custom house, from Greek tolōnion , from telōnēs collector of tolls, from telos tax, toll]

2 a.definition: to remove the effect of [the court did not the statute of repose after the statutory period had expired]
